post.content:
Here I introduce simple address book application. This application starts with login page, http://www3.sympatico.ca/scottlee/temp/login.htm and displays main lookup page, http://www3.sympatico.ca/scottlee/temp/main.htm . Main menu consists of a listbox and 1. Find - search person from listbox 2. New - add new person 3. Edit - edit existing person profile 4. Delete - delete a person from list 5. Report - display read only list for printing
When 'New' or 'Edit' button is clicked, http://www3.sympatico.ca/scottlee/temp/entry.htm will be displayed. On 'report' button, http://www3.sympatico.ca/scottlee/temp/report.htm will be displayed. All data will be saved in a relational database.
This is pretty standard and simple web application. If we build this application with Struts framework, how do we design?
Some people will prefer tutorial style solution for example, AddressbookForm, AddressbookAction and RDB. 1. How many FormBean or Action do we have to create in total? 2. Do we need to create business object class separately from Action class? 3. How can we apply MVC pattern from web page to database? 4. Can we apply one generic Action class for this application? 5. If we apply Validator plug in, can we reduce number of Form beans? 6. If we use JNDI style user access control in future, how do you design? 7. If we have wireless user interface in future, how do you design? 8. If we add EJB at backend in future, how do you design?
이상에 관한 여러분들의 경험을 듣고 싶습니다.
post.title: Struts framework design problem
